channel.title: Usb Hub - Which one to get?
channel.description:
Hello :)
Just bought my third Axoloti and I think I need to get a USB hub to power them. I just want to be able to connect all three to the same USB port on the computer and power them from there.
Are there any specific requirements for the USB hub that I should be aware of?
Or can anyone recommend a specific one to buy?
Thanks ;)

item.title: Usb Hub - Which one to get?
item.dc:creator: @trimardius
item.description:
@trimardius wrote:

for future buyers.
I recently bought this one:

RSHTECH USB Hub Active 3.0 with 15W Power Supply Aluminium USB 3.0 Hub with 7 Ports USB 3.0 Splitter for Charging and Data Transfer with Switchable Switch, LED and 5V/3A Power Supply (RSH-518-3)

around 20 euro in promotion online.

amazon.de

RSHTECH USB Hub Aktiv 3.0 mit 15W Netzteil, Aluminium: Amazon.de: Computer & Zubehör

27,99 €

It seems to work fine with 4 axo cores connected, easy on/off switching.

Read full topic
item.source: Usb Hub - Which one to get?

item.title: Usb Hub - Which one to get?
item.dc:creator: @mtyas Matthew Tyas
item.description:
@mtyas wrote:

My hub was the only one I could find at the time in the local supermarker, it was cheap and doesn't have anything special about it. I don't think they sell them anymore but this is the one : http://www.trust.com/fr/product/16131-10-port-usb-2-0-desktop-hub

Read full topic
item.source: Usb Hub - Which one to get?

item.title: Usb Hub - Which one to get?
item.dc:creator: @jaffasplaffa Mr. Grimm
item.description:
@jaffasplaffa wrote:

Hey @thetechnobear

I was just wondering about how many Axolotis you have connected to the USB hub you suggested?

This one:

www.amazon.co.uk

Plugable 10-Port USB 3.0 SuperSpeed Hub with 48W Power Adapter and Two Flip-Up Charging Ports (BC 1.2 Charging Support for Android, Apple iOS, and Windows Mobile Devices)

Plugable's Flagship USB 3.0 Hub for Maximum USB Expansion The Plugable USB3-HUB10C2 expands USB connectivity by enabling up to ten USB 3.0 or 2.0 devices to be added to any USB 3.0 or 2.0 capable desk ...

£61.95

@mtyas
Could you provide a link to the trust USB hub that you have connected 6 Axolotis to?

Thanks

Read full topic
item.source: Usb Hub - Which one to get?

item.title: Usb Hub - Which one to get?
item.dc:creator: @jaffasplaffa Mr. Grimm
item.description:
@jaffasplaffa wrote:

It might be something like that. Thanks for the tip!

But problem is that the cable is hardwired to the hub, so I cannot change it. ANyway, I started writing down how I connect it exactly and try different set ups to see what works and what not. Getting frustrated byt his now.

I am also looking at a Thunderbolt dock. Though it is a very expensive solution, it might be what I need. Thunderbolt has got lots of power and lots of connection options, so I think it would work. If I want to run a lot of Axolotis, I would probably also need an extra screen connected through the hub, so it might be a great upgrade.. I have got the hots for this one:

https://eshop.macsales.com/shop/Thunderbolt/Dock/OWC/Thunderbolt2-Dock/

Though it is pretty expensive! In Europe around 230 Pounds!!!

Read full topic

item.title: Usb Hub - Which one to get?
item.dc:creator: @johannes johannes
item.description:
@johannes wrote:

Maybe it's an unreliable USB cable rather than the hub causing issues?

item.source: Usb Hub - Which one to get?

item.title: Usb Hub - Which one to get?
item.dc:creator: @jaffasplaffa Mr. Grimm
item.description:
@jaffasplaffa wrote:

Erhhmm....

Now I got 3 connected to the hub and all are live and working.... DOnt know what to say, besides i'll never disconnect them again

EDIT: I went shopping and came home again and now the same set up dont work... again.... argh.....

Read full topic
item.source: Usb Hub - Which one to get?

item.title: Usb Hub - Which one to get?
item.dc:creator: @jaffasplaffa Mr. Grimm
item.description:
@jaffasplaffa wrote:

mtyas:

I have all my 6 axoloti's plugged into the same usb hub, and manage to use them all without any problem.

Hmm... Weird.. I tried 4 different hubs, with same result.

You mean you have 6 editors running, connected and live at the same time?

I am wondering if I do something wrong? I dont have ANY idea what it might be though. Maybe the power supply I use for the hub is not the right one? It didnt come with one so I had to find one.

Starting to get annoyed by this,,,, I think I like to get a thunderbolt hub for My macbook, cause I need to connect other things too, so I might end up getting such one, but would still need a hob to connect to the dock.

Read full topic
item.source: Usb Hub - Which one to get?

item.title: Usb Hub - Which one to get?
item.dc:creator: @mtyas Matthew Tyas
item.description:
@mtyas wrote:

I have all my 6 axoloti's plugged into the same usb hub, and manage to use them all without any problem.
It's a cheap 12 port "Trust" usb hub, with separate power supply. (I've also got a load of other controllers and things on the hub). I'm using windows 10

Read full topic
item.source: Usb Hub - Which one to get?

item.title: Usb Hub - Which one to get?
item.dc:creator: @jaffasplaffa Mr. Grimm
item.description:
@jaffasplaffa wrote:

Ok. Back again with the USB-hub issue.

Turns out that having 2 connected via this usb hub, was just a lucky incident. Have tried many times since and still it does not works everytime. VEry rarely actually.

Think I am going to try @thetechnobear HUB suggestion now.

I am also starting to think about getting a thunderbolt docking station with many usb inputs instead. Anyone have tried USB hub?

Read full topic
item.source: Usb Hub - Which one to get?

item.description:
@thetechnobear wrote:

The plot thickens ...

item.source: Usb Hub - Which one to get?

item.title: Usb Hub - Which one to get?
item.dc:creator: @jaffasplaffa Mr. Grimm
item.description:
@jaffasplaffa wrote:

Well what do ya know.

I now tried with 2 Axos with NO Axocontrol fitted to it. Now I could load advanced patches on BOTH boards and the stay connected. Seems the opposite of your experience @thetechnobear . Need to do some more testing before celebrating too much.... But it is a start

I have connected the Axo with the add on board to its own usb channel and the two bare boards to the hub and all works for now. To be honest my Axo add on board is not the finest solder job ever made. Was my first DIY project, so maybe there are some mistakes that have an unwanted effect in some way. But now it works I still have some disconnects but I can use them all at once

The 2 bare board give this info when both are connecte to the hub:
5v: 4.81
VDD: 3.30

5v: 4.75
VDD: 3.30

About the same as the first readings I posted.

Read full topic
item.source: Usb Hub - Which one to get?

item.title: Usb Hub - Which one to get?
item.dc:creator: @thetechnobear Mark Harris
item.description:
@thetechnobear wrote:

jaffasplaffa:

one of them also has got the modular thing add on board. FOrgot to mention that earlier. Does that play a role?

nope, one of mine that I tested with has the axocontrol fitted to it too

Read full topic
item.source: Usb Hub - Which one to get?

item.title: Usb Hub - Which one to get?
item.dc:creator: @jaffasplaffa Mr. Grimm
item.description:
@jaffasplaffa wrote:

thetechnobear:

if I have my hub 'unpowered' with 1 axoloti I'm at 4.30v, and with 3 axoloti I'm down to 4.13v.
sure they are reported in 'red' as being under voltage, but still were running patches ok.
one small caveat here, I'm not pluginng headphones, or line out or any devices into them, that might increase load more.

I dont really understand it then. It should be enough power then. i have outputs connected and one of them also has got the modular thing add on board. FOrgot to mention that earlier. Does that play a role? Will check with the 2 clean boards I have with no add ons.

Also I think Ill write an email to Elektron and ask them about their hub. To get more specific detials than their webside gives.

Read full topic
item.source: Usb Hub - Which one to get?

item.title: Usb Hub - Which one to get?
item.dc:creator: @thetechnobear Mark Harris
item.description:
@thetechnobear wrote:

no the voltages seem good...

if I have my hub 'unpowered' with 1 axoloti I'm at 4.30v, and with 3 axoloti I'm down to 4.13v.
sure they are reported in 'red' as being under voltage, but still were running patches ok.
one small caveat here, I'm not pluginng headphones, or line out or any devices into them, that might increase load more.

(small note: Im not suggesting axolotis should be run under voltage, I merely forgot to turn on my power to my hub, Im not sure what negative side effects running on low voltages might have!)

when you connect your 3rd, can you still see the voltage on at least one of them? (Im assuming each should report 'similar' voltages)

Read full topic
item.source: Usb Hub - Which one to get?

item.title: Usb Hub - Which one to get?
item.dc:creator: @jaffasplaffa Mr. Grimm
item.description:
@jaffasplaffa wrote:

thetechnobear:

I just tested it with 3 axoloti again, just to make sure - didnt want you going on a wild goose chase

Thanks man, I appreciate it. But I guess there can be differences in computer chipsets and so on that might play a role. Don't worry I won't hold you accountable if it doesn't work, hehe

thetechnobear:

what voltage are your axolotis reporting? this is the easy way to see if your getting enough juice or not.

One reports:
5v: 4.69v
VDD: 3.29

Second reports:
5v: 4.83v
VDD: 3.30v

So it might be a bit too little voltage.

Read full topic
item.source: Usb Hub - Which one to get?

item.title: Usb Hub - Which one to get?
item.dc:creator: @thetechnobear Mark Harris
item.description:
@thetechnobear wrote:

I got the USB 2 version, as when I was looking the USB 3 didnt have the MTT chipset (this may have changed, Ive had it for quite a while)

I just tested it with 3 axoloti again, just to make sure - didnt want you going on a wild goose chase

anyway, one thing interesting... I forgot initially to turn on the power supply, and its running off my iMac.
and the 3 axoloti all worked (running tybett patch). though they did report low voltage (a bit over 4v)
then when I turned on the power supply, that they went up to the normal 5v. (as expected)

what voltage are your axolotis reporting? this is the easy way to see if your getting enough juice or not.

Read full topic
item.source: Usb Hub - Which one to get?

item.title: Usb Hub - Which one to get?
item.dc:creator: @jaffasplaffa Mr. Grimm
item.description:
@jaffasplaffa wrote:

Ok tested the new one with a power supply and it is still the same. I might add it is only 4.5v and 1.4 ampers I think it says It can change output and I tried going up to 6v instead of 4.5v, that didnt work at all. But at 4,5v, first one connects most of the time and the second one rarely.

I then tested with simple patches and advanced patches. It connects more often with simple patches than with advanced patches. Does Axoloti use more power when loading an advanced patch, using more Dsp?

I want to add that while trouble shooting I compare it to just using the macbooks own two USB inputs. Everytime I connect them there they work every single time. So I am pretty sure there is nothing wrong with the patches or the Axos nor how I am setting it up....

But really need that third usb port for it.

@thetechnobear
Did you get the usb3 or usb2 version of the hub?
I might go for the one you suggest then, hopefully it will work for me too. It doesnt really matter so much that it doesnt work for this, cause I needed one for another computer anyway, so Ill just keep it for that and try a fourth Axoloti.

Read full topic
item.source: Usb Hub - Which one to get?

item.title: Usb Hub - Which one to get?
item.dc:creator: @jaffasplaffa Mr. Grimm
item.description:
@jaffasplaffa wrote:

thetechnobear:

Im surprised your having issues, Id have thought any hub with power (as johannes said, check its power rating is 2A +) , Ive use 3 different ones with no issues at all.

Yeah me too. I have only connected 2 Axos and one connects and the second one connects very rarely. Actually with the latest hub I bought, second Axoloti have not connected yet.

Thank you for the link. Will consider that one. But first I think I am going to try what blindsmyth suggest; to use an external power supply for the latest one.

Blindsmyth:

Did you use the hub with a power supply? It doesn come with one, so you need to find one.

Ahhh, Yes I see the input. Will try to find one in the closet of lost power supplies. I probably all ready have one that will work.

Thank you for the inputs

Read full topic
item.source: Usb Hub - Which one to get?

item.title: Usb Hub - Which one to get?
item.dc:creator: @Blindsmyth Simon
item.description:
@Blindsmyth wrote:

@jaffasplaffa
Did you use the hub with a power supply? It doesn come with one, so you need to find one.
I've been using the other cheaper hub I posted, it worked ok with 2 Axolotis.

As said the external power thing is crucial, since 3 Axoloti could draw more than the 500mah your computer gives the hub.

Read full topic
item.source: Usb Hub - Which one to get?

item.title: Usb Hub - Which one to get?
item.dc:creator: @thetechnobear Mark Harris
item.description:
@thetechnobear wrote:

Im surprised your having issues, Id have thought any hub with power (as johannes said, check its power rating is 2A +) , Ive use 3 different ones with no issues at all.
also bare in mind , if/when you start plugging usb devices into the axoloti, they will also mean power requirements increase.

anyway my main one is this:

www.amazon.co.uk

Plugable USB 2.0 10-Port High Speed Hub with 20W Power Adapter and Two Flip-Up Smart Charging Ports (BC 1.2 Charging Support for Android, Apple iOS, and Windows Mobile Devices)

Featuring a simple yet flexible design, the Plugable USB2-HUB10C2-EU provides easy expansion for any USB capable system. Two ports swivel to a vertical position to allow easy insertion with one hand a ...

£34.95

this I confirmed was MTT by checking the chipset it uses, which is about the only way your going to know for sure if its MTT or not.
(though as I mentioned before, MTT is unnecessary for axoloti for now... the reason I use it, is I have other USB devices which much higher throughput requirements)

EDIT: btw, on one of my hubs (not this one) , Id did find that one of the ports didn't receive full power. (not an issue for axoloti, but was for another controller I was using)

Read full topic
item.source: Usb Hub - Which one to get?

item.title: Usb Hub - Which one to get?
item.dc:creator: @jaffasplaffa Mr. Grimm
item.description:
@jaffasplaffa wrote:

Hey again

Just bought a third usb hub that is supposed to be multi TT. This one @Blindsmyth suggested:
https://www.conrad.de/de/7-port-usb-20-hub-einzeln-schaltbar-mit-status-leds-schwarz-976193.html

It still disconnects the second board, so I guess multi TT didnt do much of a difference. @Blindsmyth are you using your usb hub for multiple Axolotis?

I am thinking it must be the power then. I found this usb hub , which is multi TT AND has got external power supply. Going to get that next. Hopefully this will be the final one, if not I am not sure where to go next. I'd like to see which exact models others use. Some links would be great.

www.amazon.com

7-Port USB 2.0 Hub, Black

7-Port USB 2.0 Hub, Black

$20.15

Read full topic
item.source: Usb Hub - Which one to get?

item.title: Usb Hub - Which one to get?
item.dc:creator: @jaffasplaffa Mr. Grimm
item.description:
@jaffasplaffa wrote:

pescenman:

I don't know too much about OSX, but on Windows there are USB port power saving options which could potentially cause problems... maybe something similar exists in OSX?

I dunno. Ill check up on it. Thanks

Blindsmyth also suggested that the power supply for the hub might not be strong enough to power several Axolotis.

Read full topic
item.source: Usb Hub - Which one to get?

item.title: Usb Hub - Which one to get?
item.dc:creator: @pescenman
item.description:
@pescenman wrote:

I have an Asus VivoBook Pro N552VX (Intel i7) with Windows 10 Pro 64-bit. But I also used the same hub on my previous laptop, a Macbook Air 2014. On both computers (with the current firmware and patcher versions), I've only experienced disconnects when using SD-card reader mode.

I don't know too much about OSX, but on Windows there are USB port power saving options which could potentially cause problems... maybe something similar exists in OSX?

Read full topic
item.source: Usb Hub - Which one to get?

item.title: Usb Hub - Which one to get?
item.dc:creator: @jaffasplaffa Mr. Grimm
item.description:
@jaffasplaffa wrote:

pescenman:

That's interesting - I use the exact same hub for my (single) Axo, with no problems. I also have a mouse and keyboard connected to the hub, and occasionally an external HD.

That is strange then. Which computer are you using, operating system, etc.?

You could should write your system details etc. into you avatars about me section. As by this post: https://sebiik.github.io/community.axoloti.com.backup/t/profile-your-setup/2231

Would make it easier to check whtat set up you have

pescenman:

Did you have problems with just one Axo, or only when connecting multiple units?

One Axo was better than 2 axos. Using 1 Axoloti also disconnected more often than when connected straight to usb port.

When I connect 2, the first one goes live pretty often, but the second one rarely goes live. I would actually go to the extend to say It only goes live one time after connection. So it is not so good.

Read full topic
item.source: Usb Hub - Which one to get?

item.title: Usb Hub - Which one to get?
item.dc:creator: @pescenman
item.description:
@pescenman wrote:

That's interesting - I use the exact same hub for my (single) Axo, with no problems. I also have a mouse and keyboard connected to the hub, and occasionally an external HD.

Did you have problems with just one Axo, or only when connecting multiple units?
